name: df-selv
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5, setvar s6
body: |- wceq(cslv, cmpo(s0, s1, universe, universe, cmpt(s2, cpw(cv(s0)), cmpt(s3, co(cv(s0), cmpl, cv(s1)), csb(s4, co(cdif(cv(s0), cv(s2)), cmpl, cv(s1)), csb(s6, cmpt(s5, cfv(csca, cv(s4)), co(cv(s5), cfv(cvsca, cv(s4)), cfv(cur, cv(s4)))), cfv(cfv(cfv(co(cv(s0), ces, cv(s4)), co(cv(s6), cimas, cv(s1))), ccom(cv(s6), cv(s3))), cmpt(s5, cv(s0), cif(cfv(co(cv(s2), cmvr, co(cdif(cv(s0), cv(s2)), cmpl, cv(s1))), cv(s5)), ccom(cv(s6), cfv(co(cdif(cv(s0), cv(s2)), cmvr, cv(s1)), cv(s5))), wcel(cv(s5), cv(s2)))))))))))
bodyPretty: ‚ä¢ selectVars =(s0 ‚àà ùïå, s1 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶(s2 ‚àà P(s0)‚Ü¶(s3 ‚àà(s0[mPoly]s1)‚Ü¶[((s0 \ s2)[mPoly]s1)/ s4][(s5 ‚àà(Scalar ` s4)‚Ü¶(s5[(√ó ` s4)](1r ` s4)))/ s6]((((s0[evalSub]s4)`(s6["s]s1))`(s6 ‚àò s3))`(s5 ‚àà s0 ‚Ü¶ if(s5 ‚àà s2,((s2[mVar]((s0 \ s2)[mPoly]s1))` s5),(s6 ‚àò(((s0 \ s2)[mVar]s1)` s5))))))))
comment: Define the "variable selection" function. The function ` ( ( I selectVars R ) `` J ) ` maps elements of ` ( I mPoly R ) ` bijectively onto ` ( J mPoly ( ( I \ J ) mPoly R ) ) ` in the natural way, for example if ` I = { x , y } ` and ` J = { y } ` it would map ` 1 + x + y + x y e. ( { x , y } mPoly ZZ ) ` to ` ( 1 + x ) + ( 1 + x ) y e. ( { y } mPoly ( { x } mPoly ZZ ) ) ` . This, for example, allows one to treat a multivariate polynomial as a univariate polynomial with coefficients in a polynomial ring with one less variable. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 21-Mar-2015.)
